description.plain:
Matthew Hauri (b. March 19, 1996), better known by his stage name Yung Gravy, is an American rapper from Rochester, Minnesota. He is known by many other aliases, including Mr. Clean, Mr. Butter, and The Young Steve Harvey among others. He began his musical career in 2016, and continues to make music that fans love.

Despite his formidable success, Gravy remained faceless on the internet until October 20, 2017, when he uploaded the music video for his breakout hit “Mr. Clean”. His signature sound includes food references, various holiday themes, and references to several well-known singers and athletes (such as George Michael, Scottie Pippen, Steve Harvey, etc). Gravy’s lyrics also consist of “flexing on one’s mother, sister, dentist, or chiropractor,” having a timepiece that “resembles the Northern lights,” and the topic of gravy, the food item itself. Yung Gravy is largely recognized by his pinup style album covers, as well as his vintage mannerisms and music samples.

Some closely-associated acts of Yung Gravy include Canadian rapper bbno$, and the producers Englewood and Jason Rich.

songs.title: Mr. Clean

description.plain:
Mr. Clean is nothing short of a fresh track with Yung Gravy on a old-fashioned type beat. First released on the 9th of September, 2016, Mr. Clean has effortlessly stacked up to 168 million streams Spotify.

Mr. Clean is dedicated to the common american household appliance “Mr. Clean”.  Gravy features his classic casanova-like lyrics.

The sample for Mr. Clean comes from an old song sung by the Chordettes, see below.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CX45pYvxDiA

The beat is simply a sped up version by a wee bit, produced by White Shinobi. The aptly named track features five cleaning appliances; Colgate (toothpaste), Listerine (mouthwash), Windex (glass cleaner), Vaseline (lotion), and of course, Mr. Clean.

The cover for the song is Window Washer by American artist Normal Rockwell, with Gravy’s labeling and branding.

songs.embed_content: Read “Mr. Clean” by Yung Gravy on Genius

songs.full_title: 1 Thot 2 Thot Red Thot Blue Thot by Yung Gravy
songs.title: 1 Thot 2 Thot Red Thot Blue Thot
songs.title_with_featured: 1 Thot 2 Thot Red Thot Blue Thot

description.plain: “1 Thot 2 Thot Red Thot Blue Thot” interpolates the famous rhyme “One Fish, Two Fish, Red Fish, Blue Fish” by Dr. Seuss. Gravy uses this catchy title as a hook and uses his signature lines to connect the hooks. This is regarded as one of his fan favorites and one of his biggest songs in his discography.

songs.title: Cheryl

description.plain:
“Cheryl” is one of Yung Gravy’s most well-known songs thanks to its catchy chorus. It found renewed popularity in 2019 and 2020 thanks to its use in many TikToks, even leading to Gordon Ramsay dancing to the song with his daughter.

On August 21, 2020, producer Jason Rich revealed that Universal Music was prepared to take legal action against the song due to an uncleared sample of Player’s 1977 hit “Baby Come Back.” “Cheryl” was removed from streaming services a few days later, but was later reinstated in February 2021 after Gravy and his team worked to clear the sample.

Gravy previously approved of the following description of the song:

The song is an adventure that Yung Gravy takes you on, where he goes to the store for some chocolate flavored milk, but instead finds a chocolate colored MILF. After dancing with her in the sundries aisle, he is shocked when he sees his dentist whom he previously piped thrice. He soon realizes that his dentist is married to the chocolate colored milf, and they proceed to enjoy a threesome in the deli.
